intro: Gynandropsis palmipes, commonly known as the African sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and branched stems. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It is adapted to survive in dry conditions, storing water in its thick leaves and stems. Gynandropsis palmipes is often found in sandy or gravelly soils and is used in traditional medicine in some African countries.
